Pre-Game Insights: La Verde have suffered six consecutive losses, scoring just two goals in these games.
La Vinotinto have suffered just one loss in the qualifying campaign thus far, conceding just three goals.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The hosts have just one win in their six qualifying games thus far while La Vinotinto have won twice but are in fourth place in the standings.
Others: Óscar Villegas will take charge of his first game as the team's manager and will look to begin his reign on a positive note.
Yangel Herrera was ruled out of the meetings against Bolivia and Uruguay due to a thigh injury and Jesús Bueno was added to the squad as his replacement.
